title: Quantum Physics: Potential Wells
autoPauseDescription: Automatically pause the simulation when the browser tab is not visible
numericalMethodDescription: Choose the numerical method for solving the Schrödinger equation.
numerovDescription: Traditional shooting method - accurate and stable for most potentials
matrixNumerovDescription: Matrix diagonalization using Numerov formula - combines O(h⁴) accuracy with robustness
dvrDescription: Matrix diagonalization method - faster and more robust for complex potentials
fghDescription: Plane wave basis method - natural for periodic systems with spectral accuracy
spectralDescription: Chebyshev polynomial method - exponential convergence for smooth functions
quantumBoundDescription: Advanced shooting method with adaptive energy bracketing and secant refinement
gridPointsDescription: Number of grid points for numerical solvers. Higher values give more accurate results but slower computation.
oneWellScreenSummary: Explore the behavior of a quantum particle confined in a single potential well. Observe how the wave function and probability density evolve over time, and see how changing the well parameters affects the energy levels and quantum states.
twoWellsScreenSummary: Investigate the quantum mechanics of a particle in a double potential well system. Discover how the wave functions split into symmetric and antisymmetric states, and explore quantum tunneling between the wells.
manyWellsScreenSummary: Examine the behavior of quantum particles in multiple potential wells. Study how the energy bands form and how the wave functions extend across multiple wells, similar to electrons in a crystal lattice.
oneWellDescription:
Explore quantum mechanics in a single potential well.
Adjust the well parameters to see how energy levels change.
twoWellsDescription:
Explore quantum tunneling in a double potential well.
Adjust barrier parameters to see how tunneling probability changes.
Watch particles tunnel through classically forbidden regions!
manyWellsDescription:
Explore energy bands in a periodic potential.
Add or remove wells to see how energy bands form.
This demonstrates the foundation of solid-state physics!
oneWellSummary: One Well screen shows a single quantum potential well with adjustable parameters.
twoWellsSummary: Two Wells screen demonstrates quantum tunneling between two potential wells.
manyWellsSummary: Many Wells screen demonstrates energy band formation in periodic potentials.
superpositionInstructions:
Adjust the amplitude of each eigenstate in the superposition.
The sum of squared amplitudes should equal 1.
oneWellKeyConcepts:
• Quantum confinement in a single potential well
• Discrete energy levels (eigenstates)
• Wave-particle duality
• Probability density |ψ|²
• Heisenberg Uncertainty Principle
oneWellInteractions:
• Click energy levels to see eigenstates
• Adjust potential well parameters
• Try different potential types
• Create wavepackets from superpositions
• Watch time evolution of superposition states
oneWellEducationalContent:
Screen Overview:
This screen demonstrates quantum confinement in a single potential well. Energy levels are quantized and the particle's wave function is described by standing wave patterns (eigenstates).

Available Controls:
• Potential Well Type: Select different quantum potential configurations
• Energy Levels: Click on energy levels to view corresponding eigenstates
• Superposition: Create wave packets by combining multiple eigenstates

Learning Objectives:
• Understand how quantum confinement leads to discrete energy levels
• Explore the relationship between well parameters and eigenstate properties
• Observe how uncertainty principle manifests in confined quantum systems
twoWellsKeyConcepts:
• Quantum tunneling through barriers
• Energy level splitting
• Symmetric and antisymmetric states
• Tunneling probability
• Time-dependent oscillations between wells
twoWellsInteractions:
• Adjust barrier height and width
• Change well separation distance
• Select energy levels to see tunneling states
• Create superpositions to watch tunneling dynamics
• Observe how barrier parameters affect tunneling probability
twoWellsEducationalContent:
Screen Overview:
This screen demonstrates quantum tunneling in a double potential well. Particles can tunnel through classically forbidden barrier regions, leading to energy level splitting and oscillatory behavior.

Available Controls:
• Barrier Parameters: Adjust height and width to control tunneling probability
• Well Separation: Change the distance between wells
• Energy Levels: Click on split energy levels to view symmetric/antisymmetric states

Learning Objectives:
• Understand quantum tunneling and its dependence on barrier properties
• Explore energy level splitting due to quantum coupling between wells
• Observe time-dependent tunneling dynamics in superposition states
manyWellsKeyConcepts:
• Energy band formation
• Allowed and forbidden energy bands
• Band gap in periodic potentials
• Bloch waves and crystal momentum
• Foundation of solid-state physics
• Conductors, semiconductors, and insulators
manyWellsInteractions:
• Adjust number of potential wells
• Change lattice constant (well spacing)
• Modify well and barrier parameters
• Select different energy bands
• Observe band structure formation
• Watch Bloch wave propagation
manyWellsEducationalContent:
Screen Overview:
This screen demonstrates energy band formation in periodic potentials, the foundation of solid-state physics. As you add more wells, discrete energy levels spread into continuous bands separated by gaps.

Available Controls:
• Number of Wells: Add or remove wells to see band structure emerge
• Lattice Constant: Adjust the periodic spacing of the potential
• Band Selection: Select different energy bands to view Bloch states

Learning Objectives:
• Understand how periodic potentials create energy band structure
• Explore the relationship between number of wells and band formation
• Connect quantum mechanics to properties of solids (metals, semiconductors, insulators)
introDescription:
Get started with quantum mechanics in a potential well.
Explore basic quantum concepts with a simplified interface.
introKeyConcepts:
• Quantum confinement basics
• Energy levels in potential wells
• Wave function and probability density
• Exploring different potential types
introInteractions:
• Select different potential well types
• Adjust well width and depth
• View energy levels and wave functions
• Switch between probability density and wave function displays
introEducationalContent:
Screen Overview:
This introductory screen provides a simplified interface to explore quantum mechanics in potential wells. Focus on understanding the basics without the complexity of time evolution or superposition states.

Available Controls:
• Potential Well Type: Select different quantum potential configurations
• Well Parameters: Adjust width and depth to see how energy levels change
• Display Mode: Switch between probability density and wave function views

Learning Objectives:
• Understand quantum confinement in potential wells
• Explore how well parameters affect energy levels
• Visualize wave functions and probability densities
